arts.ttl: Steve Bruce makes big Birmingham City prediction and gives nod to Knighthead
arts.sum: Blues lead second-placed Wrexham by a point and have two games-in-hand going into the New Year. Steve Bruce has backed Birmingham City to win League One by ‘15 or 20 points’ – despite his Blackpool team achieving the rare feat of avoiding defeat at St Andrew’s.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings as several disappoint in bore draw with Blackpool
arts.sum: Blackpool had the better chances in a game where Blues didn’t threaten the goal until the closing stages. Chris Davies was forced into a second change shortly before half-time after Hansson went down off the ball.

arts.ttl: Steven Fletcher's dramatic late winner sees Wrexham leapfrog Wycombe as Birmingham City stumble
arts.sum: A round-up of the action from League One and League Two and Wrexham were the day's big winners

arts.ttl: Blackpool hold leaders Birmingham to draw on Steve Bruce’s St Andrew’s return
Willumsson opens up on ‘new thing’, what Birmingham City don’t talk about and targets
arts.sum: Willumsson played a starring role in Blues’ Boxing Day victory over Burton Albion and three more games are on the horizon, starting with Blackpool on Sunday. Willum Willumsson is used to having Christmas off but the Icelandic is happily rolling with the punches to keep Birmingham City top of the tree in League One.

arts.ttl: Two out, one doubt: Early Birmingham City team news for Blackpool clash
arts.sum: Chris Davies hopes to be able to call upon in-form Keshi Anderson when Birmingham City entertain Blackpool on Sunday after the winger was withdrawn at half-time on Boxing Day. Sampsted has missed Blues' last eight games with an ankle injury, while Wright hasn't featured since mid-October.

Birmingham look back to their absolute best with the Boxing Day victory over Burton making it six wins on the bounce heading into their final game of the year. But with second-place Wycombe still hot...

arts.ttl: Steve Bruce pays Birmingham City a compliment and makes reception prediction
arts.sum: Bruce, now 63, spent six years managing Blues in the early noughties and led the club to the Premier League on two separate occasions. “They’re the best team in the league - we’re under no illusion, it’s going to be a very difficult game, but if we play like we did against Wrexham (lost 2-1), I’m convinced we can give anyone a game,” said Bruce.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City receive major backing ahead of bumper away day
arts.sum: Blues' ticketing account on social media has confirmed they have been granted a further number which will boost the club's away backing on the day to more than 4,500. At Wigan, though, away supporters are generally granted the whole stand behind the goal and Blues, as expected, have taken the maximum number of tickets on offer in order to ensure that Chris Davies and his players will be fully backed by a sizeable following from the West Midlands.

arts.ttl: Tony Mowbray in running for new job and ex-Birmingham City boss could get Wayne Rooney the sack
arts.sum: Ex-Birmingham City manager Tony Mowbray is among the early favourites to become Stoke City’s new boss after the Potters sacked Narcis Pelach. A 2-0 defeat to Leeds United on Boxing Day proved to be the final straw for Pelach who was dismissed late on Friday evening after just three months in the job.
